website_summaries.verdict: A superb piece of equipment for the great outdoors. If you have a wish list of monocular features, this has almost all of them.
pros: Armored, nonslip exterior, waterproof, and fogproof
Add superior optics, excellent performance, and one-handed focusing, and you have a winning combination
cons: Would benefit from a tripod mount
No wrist strap and nowhere to attach a lanyard

customer_reviews.title: Eyecup issues hurt usability
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. Unit is light and seems durable enough. However, I noticed immediately that the view was becoming obscured when trying to look through the eye cup. Turns out the eye cup rubber is deforming with even slight pressure and obscuring a large portion of the eyepiece. So you have to hold the unit against your eye with absolutely no pressure to be able to see the full unobscured image. While I appreciate the comfort associated with the eye cup, it really hurts the usability of the product. Considering this unit costs roughly double that of the cheaper Chinese models, I expected better quality control in regards to such a sensitive component.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Nice but No 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, well-made product but I wished it had a few extras. The bottom cap is attached to the Monocular but the eye cap is not. A loose cap will soon get lost. There no hand strap or way to attach one. And the case that comes with the Monocular does not have a strap. It is easy to focus, it is lightweight, and it powerful and I do get a clear view (with and without glasses) but it's a pain getting it in and out of the case ... So for the lack of extras - I can only give it 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: ALR

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Magnification and Clarity, Smaller than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected and this accounts for the tripod to not raise the Monocular to a more comfortable height when checking bullet strikes. The clarity and maginifacation is very good. All in all I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LaundryNumber 36

customer_reviews.title: not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: barely got this thing wet crossing a river and now its totally useless. it even says waterproof on it, so sad right now. looking into warranty info now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm quite happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about optics. That being said, I'm quite happy with my purchase. The optics are crisp and clear, and the magnification is perfect for my needs. I was worried about going 12x50, worried that it would be too shaky on the highest magnification, but so far it's not been an issue. The weight, built, texture and heft feel good in the hand. Like I said: I'm happy.... and like I also said, I know nothing about optics, so my happiness is not the best measure.
customer_reviews.author: Hermit

customer_reviews.title: Good at duxk, very clear, great value for money
customer_reviews.text: The quality for the money is hard to beat. The image and brightness are on par with Nikon acculon 50 mm poor prism binoculars. For my purposes of hunting in the 200-400 yard range these are perfect. Easy to use with one hand, bright enough for dusk and dawn use, clear enough to get a good look at the animal. I am switching from a pair of roughly 10by40 vortex poor prism binoculars to this. This will be a big improvement especially in dim light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Item but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: The products overall quality was great. Optics are very nice with clear, sharp viewing capabilities. The biggest downside was that the item is rather heavy for one handed use but I imagine that is to be expected for this caliber of product. Overall I would recommend if weight is not an issue. One note, the item does come with a small tripod which unfortunately my particular one did not (item was missing). The tripod would be a nice add on for use in a non-mobile scenario. But if you are on a hiking trail as I was, the mini-tripod would not have helped much.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: A handy assistant for you when you travel and carry a camera bag on traveling.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the scope. I purchased it to keep by my lounge chair to watch birds at my feeder. I know them all by sight, but as I age. I also started to travel now I am retired and I find carrying a camera and binoculars is cumbersome. This scope if a fine instrument and the optics are quality addition. I would recommend the monocular to anyone who is interested in assisting your sight, and I'm happy with the one hand operation. A very handy tool for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Low Crawl

customer_reviews.title: Not a true spotting scope by any means. But ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a true spotting scope by any means. But, it works well for me, at my ranges, .22lr plinking range. Approximately 45 yards at its longest range and I can see all that I need. Do your homework and you will learn what limitations to expect with this optic. If your willing to except them, you will be pleasantly surprised at it value.
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: Great for a hunter
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted binoculars for spotting and hunting. I gave him this to try and he is pleasantly surprised at how easy to use and carry they are. Half the weight and size of binoculars. Easier to focus and faster to get into action. Attached a 4/20 threaded screw based "handle adapter" that allows a lanyard to be attached.  This offers drop prevention for tree stands, boating, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Beckey

customer_reviews.title: Husband is happy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband and he loves it. It is so easy to use especially the focus that can be changed with one hand. The clarity is awesome and I was amazed how clear it was when he told me to look through it. So happy for him that after all his searching he found one he liked.. He chose this one over all the others and it has to be good for he is fussy when it comes to things like this. Great product and great price....can't go wrong with that. It is also light weight so your hand doesn't get tired from holding it. Waterproof, fog proof, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W

customer_reviews.title: Fogged Up Lens Permanently after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Used it once, within the two weeks the lens is fogged up and I can not see out of it. Not sure what happened. I didn't realize they only offer a 30 day return policy and no warranty beyond 30 days either. I reached out to the company at 40 days and they wouldn't let me return it and just reverted me back to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Will Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality image, immediately returned.
customer_reviews.text: I have a set of Nikon binoculars and hoped this would be a nice addition, perfect for viewing activity at a Bluebird nesting box in my yard. I quickly realized that my binoculars, which are not remotely high end, have a far clearer image than this Polaris. I followed the instructions that came with it, adjusted the eyepiece and focus, but still it wasn't crisp and clear. I immediately returned it. I have since been told by an expert that is one piece of equipment in your birding equipment that proves "you get what you pay for". Unfortunately quality really only comes with paying a far higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Kim in LA

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for the price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from this scope as there are so many different names out there and many opinions based on one's preference, it's really difficult to find the right scope for the price. Wingspan nailed it for my very picky checklist for a scope. I wanted a small scope with focus that was clear as the eye can see. This scope has exactly what I was looking for and better than those bigger scopes with long range zoom but cannot focus worth a crap. This scope does a better job of focusing on objects beyond it's zoom capability than the scopes with longer field of zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Truth in Advertising...
customer_reviews.text: I have a few optics that I use to glass for hunting. I'd say my too expensive but top of the line Bushnell binos gives me the greatest view in the field or in the mountains. BUT, as has been said, the Polaris is like carrying nothing and I have gone the way of the Monocular. It's a great, well priced piece of tactical equipment and is indeed also good for bird watching. Like when I've bagged a deer and want to field dress it before the carrion get any ideas. I give this five stars because it delivers what it advertises, which is good indeed.
customer_reviews.author: RavMoshe

customer_reviews.title: Still takes two hands to hold it steady
customer_reviews.text: Mostly satisfied; glad I bought it. I'm blind in one eye and binoculars are superfluous for me except for the fact that binoculars are easier to hold steady when two hands are used. At this magnification, it is almost essential to hold it with two hands. I would have loved to have a shake reducing feature, but could find no monocular with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul38

customer_reviews.title: Polaris 12X50 Monocular
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally clear image, light weight, and easy to focus...perfect for deer hunting. Comes with a small tripod which makes it convenient when in a blind ...just set it and forget it. The case is adequate but has a smallish belt loop. First monocular writer has ever used for hunting but I now prefer it over my heavy binoculars of the same power 12x50. Good buy & price was competitive. Can't say yet about waterproof abilities but normally try to protect all optics while in the field from the elements. Happy with the purchase & recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: TRACKER

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: First time using a monocular and it is great! I can have both eyes open, comfortable to hold, simple to use. Yesterday I saw that Northern Flickers do not eat the way I thought! The view is It is clear and up close. I was able to watch the bird scoop out the insects . Never saw that before even with very good binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: January736

customer_reviews.title: A very nice item, however...
customer_reviews.text: Even thought this is a very nice item, I returned it because I am just not coordinated enough to use it as quickly as you need to. i.e you hear the bird; then you sight the bird, then you need to adjust the viewer in order to maximize the quality of the picture and by the time all is perfect, the bird has flown away.
customer_reviews.author: granny70

customer_reviews.title: Nice little scope.
customer_reviews.text: I steadied the scope and my iPhone on the windowsill, and the photos below show the difference between just the iPhone and the iPhone plus the scope. Note it's not terribly easy to do this by hand, but you can get an adapter to make it easier. It's a nice little scope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little bulky but great optics and durability
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my son who is an avid outdoorsman. I tried it out when I received it. The image through the scope is crystal clear. The focus knob is smartly placed for one handed use. There is a tripod mounting receptor on the bottom. It's a little bulkier than some other monoculars but I like the quality of this one and it feels durable and well made. My son was very happy when he opened it!
customer_reviews.author: Trnjjohn

customer_reviews.title: NOT that high power.
customer_reviews.text: not all that powerful. i use this when sighting in rifles and at 100 yards the bullet holes are barely visible on a splatter target. For $70 I really expected better. The tripod is 4 or 5 inches tall, so unless your table is at chin level it's very difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hall

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny..
customer_reviews.text: This is a amazing product. It is crystal clear and zooms in better then my dads "hi dollar" binoculars. I have no vision in one eye so why carry binoculars but what I have also learned is the weight is better and I had them with me everywhere while in Colorado Elk hunting with my dad. I went to my neighborhood army surplus store and for $25 I bought a sweet case that I could throw over my shoulder and carryied lens cleaner and a bunch of other small things that you want to have with you while hunting down big game. Highly recommend this product..
customer_reviews.author: MotoMikeD2R

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husbands birthday and he loves it! We live in a high rise apartment that over looks the Elizabeth River Harbor. This is perfect for looking out at the tugboats, ships, sailboats, and even dolphins. The view is large and clear and it holds easily and steady in your hand. You also get a great case for holding it and a small tripod if you really need to steady it on something. I looked at a lot of different binoculars and monoculars both online in Amazon and other places and this looked like a winner. I made the right choice for sure. Great for the price as well!
customer_reviews.author: BeachJean

customer_reviews.title: Best Monocular on the market
customer_reviews.text: Love this scope. This is my second one. My first one got misplaced and I can't live without having this handy for bird watching. It's small enough to put in my pocket and the 12x zoom beats any pair of binoculars. Picture is very, very clear. Unfortunately since the original company got bought out by Wingspan, it doesn't come with the little tripod anymore, but didn't really use that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ream

customer_reviews.title: Good product for my hard of seeing EYE.
customer_reviews.text: I am legally blind and wanted to use this monocular to help me read the arrival//departure boards in the airports. I am just back from a trip that took me through 4 airports (2 going & 2 coming back). This monocular worked just fine for me. It let me read the boards a lot easier than any of the other monoculars that I have been using. The 50mm objective lens lets in all the light that I need. The 12X power makes it a little 'jingly', but leaning up against a wall takes care of that. I am happy with it and am glad I spent the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: MAKA PO

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with the Wingspan Explorer monocular! It’s well balanced by weight and easy to hold, as well as easy to focus. I watch my husband swim in the Pacific, and I can keep the monocular on the same setting for the whole 2K. The lenses do not move or shake at all. I’m so glad they came with a nice case too! Highly recommend 😊
customer_reviews.author: Anja

customer_reviews.title: Easy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: High quality and easy to handle. I have arthritis and it is very comfortable for my crooked fingers and knuckles. I appreciate the clearness of the visual and how easy it is to focus. It arrived securely packaged. The seller was attentive and offered any help or questions. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R. James

customer_reviews.title: This monocular is awesome !!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery , 3 days from when I ordered it , ( Awesome ) !! I took this monocular to a wetland management area behind where I live , ( no hunting allowed ) , & it was amazing , I could see the birds , ( approximately 1500 yards ) , as if they were right next to me ! Not sure about the enclosed tripod , as it is only a tabletop model & I really can't see where you would use it in the field , at any case I would highly recommend this monocular , well worth the price ! I am one very satisfied customer !! Thank You Very Much !!!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchel W. Racanelli

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for archery target spotting and it has not disappointed. I have trouble with binoculars, so I thought I'd try a monocular. It's lighter than a pair of similarly-powered binos, which is great, since I carry it around all the time on my belt in the provided case, which has a belt loop. It's been extremely useful. Everyone who has looked through it has commented on how clear and bright the image is. If you've got shaky hands you might have some trouble keeping a steady image because it's 12x but I stabilize it against my eyebrow and don't have any problems. I'm very satisfied with this purchase; it's a steal at the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Defective upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I received mine today and noticed a hair line on the left of view(see photo). Tried cleaning the outter lenses but I believe its on the inside of the scope.
customer_reviews.author: dim3m

customer_reviews.title: Extreme clarity
customer_reviews.text: Never thought my husband would be happy with a pair of binoculars. He was looking for a pair with 500 to 1000 yards range without fogging up all the time. He couldn't believe the clarity of these monocular. He loves how they are small and can fit in his pocket. He says they are better than the nikons he has. We even purchased and returned a few pair day/night binoculars. Disappointed in all except the Polaris Explorer. Now looking for adapters to make these night vision. My husband does alot of hunting coyote, deer, small game and he is extremely excited to go out to hunt now.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly, securely packaged along with the carrying case I also purchased. Seem so be very well made and sturdy. The accompanying lanyard, however, seems cheaply made and is so small it's unuseable which, while not a critical defect, is annoying. Also, the viewing field is smaller than it appears but it mat simply require some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Richard V. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Great piece for the price. Just small enough to fit in my pocket for short periods of time--to save frequent trips to my backpack. The back lens cover doesn't stay attached to the body, so I added a string and tied it on. I found it easy enough to focus with a single finger on the knob, so it's definitely possible to operate one-handed. If I had a single complaint it is that there's a decent amount of chromatic aberration (purple and green fringing around areas of high contrast). At this price range, though, I will forgive it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Liked so much, bought a 2nd one.
customer_reviews.text: Keep one at summer & winter homes. I wear trifocals glasses and have a small eye span, so regular binoculars eye holes never closed close enough. Also couldn’t see w/o taking off glasses. A real pain. Have great view with this monocular AND I don’t have to take off my glasses! Easy to carry and grab catch a look at the wild life and nature.
customer_reviews.author: Rural_FL

customer_reviews.title: Great for bird feeders.
customer_reviews.text: I am terribly nearsighted. So when my husband put up bird feeders in our back yard, I had difficulty identifying specific birds. So I got this and I love it! I can see the detail on birds, and quickly identify. Our bird feeders are 20-25 feet from back windows and another 25 feet to our back property or woods. So this monocular works great for 20-45 feet. You do have to hold steady, but when you want to see, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Opt to Adopt

customer_reviews.title: Good Optic
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for bird and animal watching on my property. It provides a crystal clear view and it’s great for spotting the herd of deer that call our woods their home. It’s good enough that I can tell the deer apart from their markings. Easy to carry on treks into the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Karwyn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Just got this delivered but haven't used from my kayak yet which is main purpose. Quality though seems excellent and view is clear, bright. I can read numbers on mailboxes down the road about 500-700 ft away. Easy one-hand operation and a lot less bulky than my old binoculars. Really looking forward to using it on the water.
customer_reviews.author: DFarkas

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday. Seems to be of good quality, works as advertised. Would've gone five stars, but haven't had it long enough yet. My only other "optics" are a small pair of Bushnell binoculars (16x32) and these have a much larger picture and reach out much farther. I'm literally able to read the 2"x4" label on the transformer atop a utility pole a block away. For this price, I'm very much satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Paul McCoppin Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Clear and easy to focus
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Clear and easy to focus. I use it for checking targets in 10 meter Olympic air gun shooting. I can easily see .17 cal pellet holes in target at 10 meters. Only drawback is the threaded hole to attach the tripod is very close to one end and little tripod included with the monocular cannot stand up with the monocular on it. If the threaded hole to mount on a tripod was in the middle, the tripod would be able to support the monocular. I use a small tripod for medium size cameras to hold up the monocular.
customer_reviews.author: les

customer_reviews.title: Solid monocular
customer_reviews.text: This product came on time well packaged. It was heavier than I expected and seems to be solidly built. I plan to use it hiking an for birding trips so I practiced with it on my deck. Objects were very clear and the zoom was as good as expected. Like others have mentioned it is weighty with good zoom such that, if your hand is shaking it is magnified when hand held. I may upgrade the rating after I take it for a real field trip.
customer_reviews.author: John P Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Best Minocular for hunting or just scanning the fields for wildlife
customer_reviews.text: Took me awhile reply because this was a Birthday present for my husband. With 2 wild turkeys dancing in our field, I ended up giving to him early so he could scout his prospects. He loves this monocular and is very impressed of the clarity and distance it provides !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sally A Powers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I love this, it is exactly what I was looking for to carry with my camera on bike rides on the C&O canal. It's small enough to fit in the camera bag and still provides excellent magnification and a clear view. I think a monocular is much easier to quickly acquire a view than a binocular. There is less searching around before you see the object and can focus on it. I guess its because you have the other eye to provide the visual point of reference. I agree with others in that it needs a cord or lanyard for the front eye cover.
customer_reviews.author: RJfmVa

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This scope is being used for bird watching. It's a very good scope, easy to use/focus and works well for bird watching. It is an excellent scope for the value. I do not use it for nights or under low light conditions so I can not accurately evaluate it for those features.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wang

customer_reviews.title: A FIVE stars product.
customer_reviews.text: I had 3 binoculars, since the day I got this Polaris monocular all the other three go to the box in the garage. I used the Polaris monocular to scout everything outdoor, and with the stand I used it indoor low light target shooting , I don't have to move the target sheet in out no more. This is one of the best bino/mono cular scope I ever used. The design is ergonomic one hand operated, the price is so attractive will buy couple more for the gifts to my son and my friends on the Xmas time. A FIVE stars product.
customer_reviews.author: Daves

customer_reviews.title: My new Polaris 12x50 monocular...
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8x21 $20 no-name binocular that does a pretty good job of reading 'Lufkin' on an oil pump about a half mile away across the field from my place. This Polaris monocular... which is bulkier... brings it up closer with the exact same clarity. I want to wait and see if I can also read a license plate at the same oil pump with the same clarity... and I'll get back to you after I do. I can't do this with my 8x21.
customer_reviews.author: Cherrise

customer_reviews.title: The best monocular for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been shopping for awhile, nearly a year, looking for a great monocular. I found it in the Polaris Explorer 12X50 High Powered Monocular. The clarity at zoom is incredible. Personally I am a little shaky so holding the monocular doesn't make for perfect viewing, however it comes with a small tripod that fits nicely in the included case. It is super easy to set up and I can scan in the distance for wildlife and birds. I am finding this monocular to far exceed others I have tried, definitely a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: noeau

customer_reviews.title: Less cumbersome than a pair of binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Unit functions as needed. The focus is hard to turn but seems to be getting easier as I use it, The eye piece moves out which helps with focus. I find that I am using it with both eyes open as I do when I shoot a scoped rifle. The tripod that is included is very short and am not sure that the purpose is for including it. I have tried it on a table but have to bend to an uncomfortable position to use it. I haven't tried it on one of my tall tripods. It is less cumbersome than a pair of binoculars, and will look for a good neck strap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Gonder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: It is heavier than I expected but I think this means quality. I bought this instead of binoculars because I thought I would get more for my money this way, and I did. Am using it for hiking and I can sit on the hills and view the landscape, and wildlife. It is easy to use and has excellent optics, with crystal clear clarity. Very clear. I find it it easy to use and works great without glasses......if I show it to friends, they will want to borrow it.
customer_reviews.author: amazonuser

customer_reviews.title: LACKING CLARITY AND RESOLUTION
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scope for a while now and out of the box it was ok but I bought it to use at night.. Well the lights and stars are all bleeding out and it cannot focus to the point.. maybe its flawed IDK but for $60 i want something better than what I got... I would not recommend this product....even though it appears as it does its just a disappointment completely!
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Kilburg

customer_reviews.title: Great one hand operation and great optics....cant beat it in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, one hand operation. Nice rubbery, water proofy coating. The optics are pretty impressive for this price range, very, very clear and effective little spotting scope. The little tripod is helpful but its a complimentary item, dont expect some rediculous quality level. Its sturdy and it does its little job well. I se this for sighting in fire arms/guns/weapons and it works perfect for the range and for various outdoor concerts etc. Its handy and at that price I dont have to worry, even better. Id recommend it. Why spend more....
customer_reviews.author: Richard Perry

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monocular. My only real complaint is they didn't put something on the eye piece cover to keep it attached when you remove it. They did on the lense cover. Just something I know I'm going to lose when hunting. Besides that the quality is really nice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Bird's Eye View
customer_reviews.text: The size of the Polaris Explorer is surprisingly alright and not too big at all and can be held with one palm without any issues, and at the same time you can adjust the focus effortlessly. The image comes up crystal clear and the distance is not bad at all. It's a great outdoors tool to have and especially if you love to go bird watching. It comes with a nylon velcro pouch to store it, and you also get the small tripod stand to go with it. I wasn't disappointed at all and it lived up to its expectations as described online so far. I would say you get more bang for your buck :-P
customer_reviews.author: Olivier

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear viewing
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Takes a little getting used to using one eye but they're great for bird watching. I only wish I could have zoom in with them instead of automatically being on close-up magnification. That's my only gripe but they lens are crystal clear and like I said, great for bird-watching.
customer_reviews.author: Bkoopa

customer_reviews.title: This was my favorite purchase of 2014
customer_reviews.text: This was my favorite purchase of 2014. This monocular allows me to see the birds at my feeders on my deck up close and personal. The detail is amazing. I can even see the little tiny bird seeds in the feeder. Watching the birds shell seeds and spit the shell out is very cool. The monocular itself is very easy to focus and the tripod makes for a nice and stable viewing experience. Also the wide field of view is far superior over any of the binoculars I own. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone interested in bird watching.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: So far I am very pleased with this optic
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very pleased with this optic. I haven't had an opportunity to put it through all rigors yet. By that I mean all types of weather and low light conditions. It is quality made and very solid with good exterior protective coating. The 10X50 my be too strong for close distances. For my use it fits well. Also comes with protective cups and medium grade ballistic case that attaches to belt. K-
customer_reviews.author: K-

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Sharp image. Easy precise focus
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Sharp images to the edge. Very bright. Not too heavy given the size of the lenses. Easy to focus Handy lens caps. But the eyepiece cap will be easy to lose. A suggestion would be to have a hook or some attachment that would allow you to wear the monocular around your neck so you don't have to get it in and out of the sturdy bag. Overall I am very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing optics. I am a graphics professional who is ...
customer_reviews.text: amazing optics. I am a graphics professional who is very familiar with what constitutes a "good lens". I am a graphics programmer by profession, and also a photographer who uses professional imaging equipment. This scope has very good optics, is bright, clear. It is exactly what I was hoping it was, a practical, compact, lightweight scope with great optical properties. I use it when hiking. The images are sharp, detailed and the viewfinder is bright and clear. The scope is handheld and lightweight, very practical for long hikes.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: a bit more powerful than many would want (more power makes viewing more shaky) but I really like it. I do wish it had a lanyard
customer_reviews.text: High quality, a bit more powerful than many would want (more power makes viewing more shaky) but I really like it. I do wish it had a lanyard, but there is a screw socket in which I will configure something of that sort. I use mine while kayaking for watching wildlife, and it is nice for moon viewing and star gazing also. Aircraft viewing is another plus.
customer_reviews.author: rugslayer

customer_reviews.title: but the rest of the features are better: wider field of view
customer_reviews.text: Almost same time I received as a present Nikon binocular (8x25, Trailblazer H2Oproof). Nikon has a bit less the magnification, but the rest of the features are better: wider field of view, sharper picture, smaller and lighter.
customer_reviews.author: DAD

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent monocular, I can recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This Monocular device hit all my marks and surpassed my expectations. The view is clear, the outside sturdy, and the salty ocean air didn't phase it for all the months I had it aboard a ship. If you're looking for a cheap monocular and don't want to compromise quality, look no further. The only thing I have to say poorly of it is the tripod that it comes with. It is finicky and isn't 100% reliable. So if you use the tripod just make sure it's within arms reach to catch it if it falls. On the upside though, mine has fallen a couple times and the monocular still works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These replaced my Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet. This is a Great Monocular and it is much easier to use than my binoculars. Truthfully, I do not even reach for my binoculars anymore. The tripod stand works great also and it is all carried in the same pouch which is very convenient. The one small issue I have is I wish there was something to keep the protective cap on. I tied some para-cord to the cap and fastened it so I would not lose it. Quick fix but something should have been included. Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Pete G

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Monucular
customer_reviews.text: This monucular manufactured by Wingspan Optics is an excellent product. The glass is clear and of a high quality. It is easy to focus in on what you are viewing. The monocular is made of durable material. I suspect that this monocular will last several years. You could comfortably use this monocular for bird watching, hiking, or even for close-target shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Robert Shisley

customer_reviews.title: Opens up the world.
customer_reviews.text: The Wingspan Optics brings the beauty of creation in closer. This morning I was mesmerized by two lake loons swimming, diving, and seemingly just enjoying being alive. Without my Wingspan Optics they would be just a couple of black lumps out on the bay.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Fronius

customer_reviews.title: Won me over
customer_reviews.text: I love birdwatching but struggle with binoculars because of my vision. Also, they're heavy and bulky. I came across this item on Amazon, and decided to try monocular viewing. I keep this on the window sill of my office, which happens to be in a birding hotspot. Compact, lightweight, easy to view and focus with one hand. Great quality for the price, too.
customer_reviews.author: HeidiR

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Tripod fell apart during unpacking. Will not tighten down, totally not functioning
customer_reviews.author: Alice P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift idea
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father-in-law but have yet to give it to him (it's for Christmas) but I've had it out and checked it over. It is a nice weight, not awkward to hold. Feels like it is made of quality materials and the view thru the eye piece is crystal clear. I can't wait to give it to him, and I might just order another for my hubby! Update: father-in-law got his early and really likes it. I did order one for my hubby and he likes his just as much!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda M.

customer_reviews.title: Polaris High Powered Monocular
customer_reviews.text: The polaris explorer 12x50 high powered monocular delivers what it says on the product. It is highly powered and you can really focused and see far away. If you are good in using just one eye and if your hands are not shaking is well ok. But if you have hands like mine that shook strongly, you need a tripod to hold the monocular so that you can see it clearly what you are looking for. Otherwise, I can say that it is a great piece of viewing device.
customer_reviews.author: YnnamofTX

customer_reviews.title: it's better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This monocular is everything the ad stated. Quit frankly, I researched these for hours, on multiple days. Then, I finally choose this Wingspan. Now I discover, it's better than I expected. Field of view is larger than I expected. Adjusting focus, is user friendly, cuz'n the location is above eye piece. Some are built into the eye piece which makes for awkward focus but not so with this Wingspan. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sid P Villandry

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scope for a couple of years and love it. High quality, no issues with moisture or quality. It has a rugged outer rubber housing, smooth focus, and great viewing quality. It is best used with a tripod or stable object for stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Super-Awesome!!!!!! WOW!
customer_reviews.text: This monocular is a BOSS! I love it. You can see the craters on the moon with this, really just stunning. Use the tripod for a really steady view. For the price I am so impressed by this. It was so worth it showing my 4yo niece the moon she has been so interested in and had so many questions about. A great product at a surprisingly low price. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sampy

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a older, less powerful monocular. I couldn't be happier with this scope. It's comfortable to hold and use and the optics are very good for the money. My other scope required a second hand to focus so this is nice that I can hold this and focus with my index finger.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell A. Starks

customer_reviews.title: Handy, quality optical instrument
customer_reviews.text: Very nice piece of optical equipment. Light, easy to use, VERY sharp, bright image. Great for being out and about, like hiking, boating, birding, checking out that person you want to get a better look at, reading the license plate of the jerk who parks near you, and uses the braille method. Well worth the modest price.
customer_reviews.author: Hal S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product. Great warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Great monocular for the price. Well made, clear view. No complaints. After a year, a manufacturing anomaly resulted in the optics becoming loose. I emailed the company describing the problem, they emailed back to say it was covered and asked for my address, I emailed them my address, they emailed back that the new one was ordered and on the way. We're talking about 4 total emails over 5 minutes and my warranty was honored and the new one was enroute. To clarify, I believe the product is well made, this was just one of those things. If you're looking for a quality monocular for a reasonable price, I recommend this. They stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 of these. I purchased the first one, because of its light weight, to to take on a trip. I think it is as good as my expensive pair of binoculars. I like to watch birds from different windows in my house. So, I purchased a second one for a second window. I can see purchasing another of this monocular again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, what an amazing product for the price. This thing is awesome, built really rugged, perfect size and works amazing. I highly, highly recommend the Wingspan Optics Explorer High Powered 12X50. Far exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Edward fxdb

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Monocular
customer_reviews.text: I used this for bird-watching and found it to be exactly what I wanted. I took it on a trip, so I wanted something that would not be bulky to pack or to carry in my purse. It was easy to focus and helped me to see some fantastic birds. I liked that the cover for the front lens was attached and wish the cover on the eye piece had also been attached, but that was a minor inconvenience. The carrying case that comes with it is also very useful.
customer_reviews.author: P. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Great Find! Good Deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monocular! The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it does not have a strap and I feel that is important. It seems to be very well made, sturdy and the view is magnificent. I don't think I could have seen birds any better if they were in the palm of my hand!
customer_reviews.author: Debra B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what we needed. We traveled to Yellowstone National Park earlier this year, and ordered the Polaris Explorer 12 x50 to help us see wildlife off in the distance more easily. It was great for that! This is just the right size to slip into a backpack or wear on a belt while hiking. I only wish we'd had the budget for more powerful optics, because of the distances often involved in that park. Still, without this tool we would've missed a great deal more.
customer_reviews.author: apalestar

customer_reviews.title: Money well $pent!!!
customer_reviews.text: This will be used for hasty recons so it will be tossed around on tac vests and bug out bags so I didn't want to spend $180. I took a chance ordering this based on reviews and price. All I can say this thing is impressive for $70! Very clear out to 500 meters but you can still see things on perimeters 1000 meters out. For pros I'm sure you will have your cons but for the field grunt these are plenty good Enuff! Money well spent for what I will use these for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike America

customer_reviews.title: Bright and clear
customer_reviews.text: Very easy focus. Easy to use. A little shakey and I may get a monopod for bracing. Very well made. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Serious monocular
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice monocular, although quite substantial and large. It appears basically to be one-half of a nice binocular set. I have trouble using both eyes on a device anyway, so this is perfect. You get 12x all the time, with a focus knob on the top. If you have small hands, it will take both to hold onto this. The quality is excellent, with a very good field of view. For serious watchers, this one will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Did not love it.
customer_reviews.text: wanted to love it, but didn't. Difficult to get subject in focus, somewhat fuzzy, power seemed less than advertised (compared to similar binoculars.). Wish I had returned this.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzy’s Shaka

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a cheap unit I had been using, and am I ever impressed. Crystal clear image, easy to focus. While it is bigger than the old one, not to heavy or large to make it difficult to use. Update 12/10/17 - I like this so much, I ordered a second one to leave in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A fine product at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what i was looking for! I prefer a monocular to binoculars. If this is true for you--then this is perfect because this is compact and has a supurb sharp magnification. I bought it to view the sandhill cranes that migrate through out little town in SW Colorado--but now use it to watch the sunset on the Cimerron range. it was also a deeply discounted price--like 60%+ off retail. over all--a fine product. better than i expected!
customer_reviews.author: jack sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great optics but kinda big
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. The focus wheel is precise and smooth. 12x is really pushing handheld steadiness but the 50mm really helps. It is too big to put into a pants pocket. I also purchased the Bushnell 10x25 binoculars and they are slightly smaller -- I am using it for music concerts. This scope is great but not as portable as I hoped. I'm keeping it for boating, outdoors, and as a target practice scope. I'm using the Bushnell 10x25 for traveling and concerts.
customer_reviews.author: James Barber

customer_reviews.title: Portability and Good Optics
customer_reviews.text: A well made high quality monocular. Image is clean and sharp. Easy to focus and Easy to carry in one's pocket. Comes with a lens cloth, case, small tripod, and lens covers. Do wish it would have an attachment for the eye lens cover so it want get lost though one can attach a rubber band or string to secure the lens cover to the monocular. The small tripod I am not sure I will get much use out of, but it is well made. I am sure I will get many years of use out of this monocular.
customer_reviews.author: Julian E. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Second one is a gift. Took ours to Africa!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift because we love ours. Easier to use and more accurate than binoculars. Took ours to Africa and was very pleased with the experience and capability.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Wingspan Optics Explorer is a bit heavy..but provides a beautifully clear view! Quality lenses and easy-grip body.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been on any adventures..but since i'm legally blind..the monocular provides a sharp clear image of my backyard! It would be awesome at an outdoor concert..if I wanted to see the stage!!!!! Maybe some day...
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Glad

customer_reviews.title: This is a well made addition to my shooter package ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made addition to my shooter package, used for sighting in at the range, it is clear and has plenty of magnification. It would work well for bird watching or people watching if thats what your into.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Guy

customer_reviews.title: nice monocular
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this mostly for bird watching. Its bulkier and heavier than the one he was replacing but can still easily fit in a bag/pouch and he says the view is crisp, clear and he really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: was not as clear as i thought and could not see out to 100 yards. had to return.
customer_reviews.author: FRESH!

customer_reviews.title: this item is great. We now have another viewing scope for people ...
customer_reviews.text: Comparing these to Nikon Monarch 8X 42 binoculars, this item is great. We now have another viewing scope for people on the beach. Viewing them from about 100 yards away. Yes, a little harder to find your view compared to the binoculars, and yes, a little more prone to shaking, but all in all, these are a nice addition. Definitely more powerful than the binocs. I have one bad eye so don't miss the binocular view at all. The tripod is worthless, need to find some larger and more stable tripod. But now tempted to buy 15 X 70 binocs on a a stable tripod.
customer_reviews.author: ProfWasteland

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Just finished our vacation in Yellowstone and Grand Tetons and it was so useful. You can hike and easily carry it inine hand. I was able to zoom in on the top of the Grand Teton and see all of its unique features. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Ed McEachen

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good buy for the price...It works just as well as my $180 Bushnell HD Legend Monocular. The single finger adjustment is great and easy to use. Looking forward to trying it out in Colorado next week in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof fog proof
customer_reviews.text: Only thing missing is a way to install a strap I use this for hunting maybe something to screw in were the threaded hole is for tripod don’t want to drop it when I am in tree stand
customer_reviews.author: William J Kovalcik

customer_reviews.title: Hindsight
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'd say that this monocular is average for the price. Nothing spectacular here in spite of the rave reviews. "High-Powered" is an over sell. You'll find better value in a brand name unit such as Vortex.
customer_reviews.author: KF Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Quality monocular
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, solid quality well-made monocular for the money. Good sharp bright optics. Well packaged with quality protective case. Unlike other reviewers, I do not have a problem with having to rotate the focusing ring too far to focus. Seems about right to me. I share the complaint that the eye piece cap should have a connecting strap like the other cap, so one doesn't lose it. An included lanyard would be nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Good but could have been Great
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality. Sight picture was very clear. The reason for the 4 and not a 5 was my disappointment that there was not a lanyard included. No one wants to carry a monocular or binoculars for that matter in their hands all the time. Good product but lacking an important part in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Greg in east TN

customer_reviews.title: Great for trail hiking! Light and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to take on a hiking adventure in Iceland. It came in handy many times. Very light and portable, good magnification and very clear day and night optics. Never had any signs of moisture getting in to the optics even though we were in wet rainy conditions frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Cary

product_meta.title: Wingspan Optics Explorer High Powered 12X50 Monocular. Bright and Clear. Single Hand Focus. Waterproof. Fog Proof. For Bird Watching, or Watching Wildlife. Daytime Use. Formerly Polaris Optics
feature_bullets: 12X50 MAGNIFICATION - See things 12X closer and Get Clearer and Brighter range of view with 50mm lens - The most powerful hand held monocular available in the market today, that also provides the most pleasant and clear view.
DURABLE EXTERNAL ARMOR - Provides a secure, non-slip grip, and durable external protection.
WATERPROOF AND FOG PROOF - Prevents moisture, dust, and debris from getting inside the monocular - designed to inhibit internal fogging. For any weather and any environment.
SINGLE HAND FOCUS - Ergonomic design helps you focus on your target quickly and accurately with one hand.
THE BRIGHTEST AND CLEAREST VIEW OF ANY MONOCULAR ON THE MARKET TODAY - Allows you to get the best view possible for bird watching, watching wildlife or scenery

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,401 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
